item.title: 巴西国家石油公司称反垄断监督机构同意公司免于资产出售
item.description: 巴西国营石油公司（Petrobras）周三表示，该国反垄断监管机构 Cade 批准了一项协议的新条款，该条款将使该公司得以出售部分炼油和天然气资产。【原文：Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras said on Wednesday that the country's antitrust regulator Cade approved the new terms of an agreement that will free up the company from selling some of its oil refining and natural gas assets.】

item.title: 巴西哈达德称货币政策仍 "非常具有限制性
item.description: 巴西财政部长周三表示，尽管他认为消费者价格读数良好，总体通胀率在央行的目标范围内运行，但巴西的货币政策仍处于 "非常严格 "的水平。【原文：Brazil's finance minister said on Wednesday that the country's monetary policy is still at a "very restrictive" level despite what he considers good consumer price readings, with headline inflation running within the central bank's target range.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，FTX 的班克曼-弗里德被转移到新监狱
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引被监禁的 FTX 创始人发言人的话报道，联邦官员已开始将山姆-班克曼-弗里德转移到新的监狱，驳回了他留在纽约帮助准备上诉的愿望。【原文：Federal officials began the process to transfer Sam Bankman-Fried to a new prison, overriding his wish to stay in New York while helping to prepare his appeal, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing a spokesman for the jailed FTX founder.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，迪斯尼达成出售印度 Tata Play 股份的协议
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，华特迪士尼已就出售其在 Tata Play 的股份达成交易，对印度企业集团塔塔集团旗下卫星电视供应商的估值约为 10 亿美元。【原文：Walt Disney has struck a deal to sell its stake in Tata Play, valuing Indian conglomerate Tata Group's satellite TV provider at about $1 billion, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 拉加代尔称已接近将《巴黎竞赛》杂志出售给 LVMH 集团
item.description: 法国媒体和商业集团拉加代尔公司（Lagardere）周三表示，该公司即将把旗下的《巴黎竞赛》杂志出售给奢侈品巨头路威酩轩集团（LVMH），企业价值标价为 1.2 亿欧元（1.3 亿美元）。【原文：French media and business conglomerate Lagardere said on Wednesday it is moving closer to a sale of its Paris Match magazine to luxury goods giant LVMH , on an enterprise value price tag of 120 million euros ($130 million).】

item.title: 百时美施贵宝和赛诺菲在夏威夷 Plavix 案中的责任增至 9.16 亿美元
item.description: 周二，夏威夷一名法官命令百时美施贵宝公司和赛诺菲公司向该州支付超过 9.16 亿美元的赔偿金，原因是它们未能警告非白人患者血液稀释剂 Plavix 可能带来的健康风险，而此前的判决金额为 8.34 亿美元。【原文：A judge in Hawaii on Tuesday ordered Bristol Myers Squibb and Sanofi to pay more than $916 million to the state for failing to warn non-white patients of health risks from its blood thinner Plavix, up from an earlier judgment of $834 million.】

item.title: 法国兴业银行首席执行官：欧洲银行间跨国合并在结构上不太可能
item.description: 法国兴业银行（Societe Generale）首席执行官斯拉沃米尔-克鲁帕（Slawomir Krupa）周三表示，在法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）呼吁加强银行业整合一周后，欧洲银行之间的跨国合并在结构上不太可能。【原文：Cross-border mergers between European banks are structurally unlikely, Societe Generale CEO Slawomir Krupa said on Wednesday, a week after French President Emmanuel Macron called for greater consolidation in the sector.】

item.title: 路透社活动：首席执行官称 CSX 本周全面恢复巴尔的摩煤炭出口
item.description: 巴尔的摩港是美国第二繁忙的煤炭外运贸易枢纽港，CSX 首席执行官周三表示，在施工人员清理了部分深水航道后，CSX 本周将恢复巴尔的摩港的正常煤炭出口业务。【原文：CSX this week will return to normal coal export operations at the Port of Baltimore after work crews cleared part of the deep channel serving the second busiest U.S. trade hub for outgoing coal shipments, the railroad's CEO said on Wednesday.】

item.title: EEX 与纳斯达克的交易引发欧盟对捆绑产品和价格上涨的担忧
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士周三表示，欧盟反垄断监管机构正在就欧洲能源交易所（EEX）在收购纳斯达克欧洲电力交易和清算业务时是否可能通过捆绑产品扩大市场份额的问题征求反馈意见。【原文：EU antitrust regulators are seeking feedback on whether the European Energy Exchange (EEX) might expand its market power by bundling products when it buys Nasdaq's European power trading and clearing business, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 海湾竞争对手争当航空枢纽，沙特向电动飞行出租车公司 Archer 招手
item.description: 继电动空中出租车公司宣布与经济和地区竞争对手阿拉伯联合酋长国建立合作伙伴关系之后，沙特阿拉伯已开始向 Archer Aviation 公司示好。【原文：Saudi Arabia has begun courting Archer Aviation , following the electric air taxi company's announcement of a partnership with economic and regional rival, the United Arab Emirates.】

item.title: 美国证券监管机构敦促不要通过加密货币法案
item.description: 美国证券监管机构周三敦促美国立法者不要通过一项旨在为数字货币建立新法律框架的法案，称这将破坏现有的法律先例，并使资本市场面临 "无法估量的风险"。【原文：The U.S. securities regulator on Wednesday urged U.S. lawmakers not to adopt a bill that aims to create a new legal framework for digital currencies, saying it would undermine existing legal precedent and put capital markets at "immeasurable risk."】

item.title: 凯雷出售 2.13 亿美元巴西 Rede D'Or 股份 - 报道
item.description: 据巴西当地媒体《巴西日报》和《Valor Economico》周三报道，私募股权公司凯雷将通过大宗交易出售巴西连锁医院 Rede D'Or 1.6% 的股份，价值约 11 亿雷亚尔（约合 2.1329 亿美元）。【原文：Private equity firm Carlyle is selling a 1.6% stake in Brazilian hospital chain Rede D'Or in a block trade worth about 1.1 billion reais ($213.29 million), local outlets Brazil Journal and Valor Economico reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 大众推迟在美国和加拿大推出 ID.7 电动汽车
item.description: 德国大众汽车公司周三表示，由于市场动态不断变化，该公司已推迟在美国和加拿大推出电动 ID.7 轿车。【原文：Volkswagen has delayed the launch of its electric ID.7 sedan in the U.S. and Canada, the German automaker said on Wednesday, citing changing market dynamics.】

item.title: 中国地方政府要求恒大电动车退还 2.624 亿美元补贴
item.description: 中国恒大新能源汽车公司周三表示，该公司已收到来自中国地方行政机构的信函，要求偿还 19 亿元人民币（合 2.6242 亿美元）的补贴和奖励。【原文：China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle said on Wednesday its unit had received a letter from the country's local administrative bodies demanding repayment of 1.9 billion yuan ($262.42 million) given as subsidies and incentives.】

item.title: 美国 4 月成屋销售连续第二个月下滑
item.description: 由于较高的抵押贷款利率和房价拖累了需求，美国 4 月份的成屋销售意外下降，使房地产市场再次受挫。【原文：U.S. existing home sales unexpectedly fell in April as higher mortgage rates and house prices weighed on demand, dealing another setback to the housing market.】

item.title: 解说员：新喀里多尼亚骚乱对镍矿业的影响
item.description: 新喀里多尼亚是法国在南太平洋的海外领地，也是主要的镍生产国，该地区掀起的内乱浪潮导致采矿作业停止，支撑了金属价格的反弹。【原文：A wave of civil unrest in New Caledonia, a French overseas territory in the southern Pacific that is a leading nickel producer, has halted mining operations and supported a rally in prices for the metal.】

item.title: 塔吉特、沃尔玛购物者寻求家居用品和杂货网上配送
item.description: 美国零售商表示，在大流行病后的短暂低迷之后，高油价、便捷的送货方式和优惠活动的激增刺激下，美国在线消费正在经历反弹。【原文：U.S. online spending is experiencing a rebound, spurred by high gas prices, convenient delivery options and a surge in deals following a brief post-pandemic slump, U.S. retailers say.】

item.title: WisdomTree 将在伦敦证券交易所上市加密货币产品
item.description: 英国金融监管机构已经批准了 WisdomTree 在伦敦证券交易所上市以加密货币比特币和以太币为支撑的交易所交易产品（ETP）的申请，该资产管理公司周三表示，预计将于本月上市。【原文：Britain's financial regulator has approved WisdomTree's bid to list exchange-traded products (ETPs) backed by cryptocurrencies bitcoin and ether on the London Stock Exchange, the asset manager said on Wednesday ahead of an expected launch this month.】

item.title: 英美资源集团拒绝必和必拓每股 29.34 英镑的提议
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American）周三拒绝了必和必拓集团（BHP Group）提出的每股 29.34 英镑的收购建议。【原文：Anglo American on Wednesday rejected a takeover proposal from BHP Group that valued the company at 29.34 pounds per share.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会称洲际交易所将就网络入侵案支付 1,000 万美元罚金
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（SEC）周三表示，洲际交易所（ICE）将支付 1,000 万美元的罚款，以了结其子公司未能立即向美国证券交易委员会通报网络入侵事件的指控。【原文：Intercontinental Exchange Inc (ICE) will pay a $10 million penalty to settle charges its subsidiaries failed to immediately alert the Securities and Exchange Commission of a cyber intrusion incident, the SEC said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 标准普尔 500 指数在经历强劲上涨后，2024 年底将维持在当前水平附近：路透调查
item.description: 据路透社周三公布的一项民意调查显示，标准普尔500指数（Standard & Poor's 500）今年年底将接近目前的水平，但2024年迄今股市的强劲涨势让一些策略师认为，该指数在未来几个月有回调的风险。【原文：The Standard & Poor's 500 will end the year near current levels, but strong stock market gains so far in 2024 have some strategists saying the index is at risk of a correction in coming months, according to a Reuters poll released Wednesday.】

item.title: 尼日利亚法院延期至 6 月 14 日审理 Binance 高管逃税案
item.description: 尼日利亚一家法院已将针对 Binance 的逃税案延期至下个月，以便对该加密货币交易所及其两名高管进行可能的传讯。【原文：A Nigerian court has adjourned a tax evasion case against Binance to next month for possible arraignment of the cryptocurrency exchange and two of its executives after a trial stalled on Wednesday, the judge said.】

item.title: 壳牌认为亚洲新兴市场将在全球不断增长的液化天然气供应中占据更多份额
item.description: 壳牌预计，澳大利亚供应的液化天然气（LNG）将有助于满足南亚和东南亚新兴市场的需求，这些市场将在本世纪末吸收全球供应量的部分增长。【原文：Shell expects its Australian supplies of liquefied natural gas (LNG) to help meet demand from emerging markets in south and southeast Asia, which are tipped to absorb some of the pick up in global supplies towards the end of this decade.】

item.title: 百健公司将收购人类免疫学生物科学公司，交易金额高达 18 亿美元
item.description: 百健公司（Biogen）周三表示，已同意以 11.5 亿美元的预付款和高达 6.5 亿美元的潜在里程碑付款收购私人控股的人类免疫生物科学公司（Human Immunology Biosciences）。【原文：Biogen said on Wednesday it had agreed to buy privately held Human Immunology Biosciences for $1.15 billion in upfront and up to $650 million in potential milestone payments.】

item.title: 非价格零售商 TJX 因需求强劲、成本降低而上调年度利润预期
item.description: TJX Cos 周三上调了年度利润预期，第一季度销售额超出预期，主要得益于成本下降和需求强劲。【原文：TJX Cos raised its annual profit forecast and beat first-quarter sales estimates on Wednesday, helped by easing costs and robust demand.】

item.title: 中国多个城市降低首付和房贷利率，刺激房地产需求
item.description: 据中国国家媒体报道，中国多个城市降低了首付和按揭贷款利率，以响应最近一波刺激房地产需求的措施。【原文：Several cities across China have lowered down payment and mortgage loan interest rates, in response to the latest wave of stimulus measures to boost lackluster property demand, state media reported.】

item.title: 欧盟委员会官员认为到 2030 年私人芯片投资将达到 1000 亿美元
item.description: 欧盟委员会一位官员周三表示，《欧洲芯片法案》有望在2030年前帮助欧洲半导体产业吸引价值超过1000亿欧元（1084.1亿美元）的私人投资。【原文：The European Chips Act is on track to help attract more than 100 billion euros ($108.41 billion) worth of private investment to the European semiconductor industry by 2030, a European Commission official said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 模拟器件公司预测季度收入高于预期
item.description: 模拟器件公司（Analog Devices）周三预测，第三季度收入将高于华尔街预期，这主要得益于汽车和工业芯片需求在长期低迷后出现增长。【原文：Analog Devices forecast third-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, helped by a rise in demand for its automotive and industrial chips after a prolonged slump.】

item.title: 标准普尔称，尽管汽车供应减少，但美国人的平均汽车保有年限仍达到创纪录的 12.6 年
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，美国车主对汽车的持有时间正在延长，即使 COVID 大流行造成的重大供应中断情况有所缓解，经销商的供应量也在增加。【原文：Automobile owners in the United States are holding on to their vehicles longer, according to a new study, even as major supply disruptions caused by the COVID pandemic ease and availability at dealerships rise.】

item.title: 阿根廷铁路建设者在米莱公司削减开支的阴影下备受煎熬
item.description: 阿根廷工人巴勃罗-巴斯克斯（Pablo Vazquez）在布宜诺斯艾利斯郊区拉普拉塔附近为一条火车线路铺设轨道，一天的工作刚刚结束，工头就把十几名工友叫到一起，告诉他们一个坏消息。工人们都被解雇了。【原文：Argentine laborer Pablo Vazquez was finishing a day's shift laying track for a train line near La Plata on the outskirts of Buenos Aires when the foremen called a dozen members of the team together to share bad news. The workers were all being let go.】
